009package ColorImages;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012import java.util.Random;
013
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
016import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.color.iterate.RandomHueGenerator;
018
019/**
020 * ImageJ plugin demonstrating the use of {@link RandomHueGenerator}.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 *
024 */
025public class Random_Color_Demo implements PlugIn {
026        
027        static int Tile_Size = 20;
028        static int Tiles_Hor = 48;
029        static int Tiles_Ver = 32;
030        Random rnd = new Random();
031        
032//      private float h = 0.0f;
033//      private float s = 0.9f;
034//      private float b = 0.9f;
035
036
037        @Override
038        public void run(String arg) {
039                int width = Tile_Size * Tiles_Hor;
040                int height = Tile_Size * Tiles_Ver;
041                ColorProcessor cp = new ColorProcessor(width, height);
042                RandomHueGenerator rcg = new RandomHueGenerator();
043                for (int i = 0; i < Tiles_Hor; i++) {
044                        for (int j = 0; j < Tiles_Ver; j++) {
045                                Color c = rcg.next();
046                                cp.setColor(c);
047                                cp.fillRect(i * Tile_Size, j * Tile_Size, Tile_Size, Tile_Size);
048                        }
049                }
050                
051                (new ImagePlus(getClass().getSimpleName(), cp)).show();
052        }
053}
